pebbleauthclient API#

Module contents#

pebbleauthclient.auth(token: str) → PebbleAuthToken[source]#

Authenticate a provided token into and return a valid PebbleAuthToken object

Parameters:

token – str

Returns:

PebbleAuthToken

pebbleauthclient.auth_from_http_headers(headers: dict) → PebbleAuthToken[source]#

Authenticate user using the HTTP Authorization header provided with the request

The Authorization headers must be written according to the standard :

  • Authorization name with capitalized A

  • Token content must start with “Bearer “ string (ex : Bearer full_token_string)

Parameters:

headers – All provided headers (including Authorization) in a dict

Returns:

PebbleAuthToken

Submodules#

pebbleauthclient.constants#

pebbleauthclient.constants.CERTS_FOLDER: str = './var/credentials/auth'#

Contains the local folder for temporary store authentication credentials. Storing locally the credentials improves server response.

pebbleauthclient.constants.JWKS_LOCAL_PATH: str = './var/credentials/auth/jwks.json'#

Contains the local path for the public keys set (JWKS)

pebbleauthclient.constants.JWKS_REMOTE_URI: str = None#

Return the location of remote pebble authenticator public keys set (JWKS) as defined in the sys global environment variables

pebbleauthclient.errors#

exception pebbleauthclient.errors.EmptyJWKSError[source]#

Bases: Exception

This error should be raised when the JWK set is empty. jwks.json might be corrupted, empty or not exists.

exception pebbleauthclient.errors.EmptyJWKSRemoteURIError[source]#

Bases: Exception

This error should be raised when PBL_JWKS_REMOTE_URI environment variable is empty or not set. If this error occurs, you should export PBL_JWKS_REMOTE_URI

Locally solution#
export PBL_JWKS_REMOTE_URI=https://SERVER_URI/path/jwks.json
Dockerfile solution#
ENV PBL_JWKS_REMOTE_URI=https://SERVER_URI/path/jwks.json
exception pebbleauthclient.errors.EmptyTokenError[source]#

Bases: Exception

This error should be raised when the token is not provided or empty.

exception pebbleauthclient.errors.NoAlgorithmProvidedError(kid: str)[source]#

Bases: Exception

This error should be raised when the algorithm used to decode the JWT token is empty or badly provided.

Parameters:

kid – key id that cause the error

exception pebbleauthclient.errors.NotFoundJWKError(kid: str)[source]#

Bases: Exception

This error should be raised when the JWK used to generate the token is not found in the JWK Set.

Parameters:

kid – key id that cause the error

pebbleauthclient.key#

pebbleauthclient.key.get_jwk_set() → dict[source]#

Return all the JWK currently stored in jwks.json file or in the process memory.

Returns:

dict

pebbleauthclient.key.import_remote_jwks(remote_location: str) → None[source]#

Import the public RSA key from a remote server to the local /var/credentials/auth/jwks.json file.

Parameters:

remote_location – str

Returns:

None

pebbleauthclient.key.read_jwks() → dict[source]#

Read the public RSA key from /var/credentials/auth/jwks.json and convert it into JWK Set

Returns:

dict

pebbleauthclient.token_data#

pebbleauthclient.token_data.get_licence_object_from_token_data(token_data: PebbleTokenData) → AuthenticatedLicenceObject[source]#

Provide all token data and generate a new AuthenticatedLicenceObject instance.

Parameters:

token_data – PebbleTokenData . A representation of data provided by a token

Returns:

AuthenticatedLicenceObject

pebbleauthclient.token_data.get_token_data_from_jwt_payload(jwt_payload: dict, token: str) → PebbleTokenData[source]#

Generated a PebbleTokenData instance from a dict representation of the JWT and the token string.

Parameters:

  • jwt_payload – dict of the information stored in the token

  • token – str original JWT

Returns:

PebbleTokenData
